content.p: Match the effect with the correct system.

body.p: Faster blood flow and more blood flow to skeletal muscles -
Stimulation of sweat glands to reduce excessive body heat -
A good internal body state sitting down to hearty meal -

response.feedback: Correct. Increased amount of blood and increase rate of delivery of blood to skeletal muscles facilitates “flight” in the “fight or flight” sympathetic response.
Incorrect. Parasympathetic nervous is more closely involved with maintaining a resting heart rate and will not directly impact blood vessels of skeletal muscles.

part.hint: Does the action support fight or flight or rest and digest?

response.feedback: Correct. An active body will generate internal heat due to the expenditure of energy resources such as glucose and other biochemical reactions in an active body. Sweat evaporates to help reduce this internal excess temperature.
Incorrect. Parasympathetic nervous system functions optimally to support biological mechanisms for a resting and digesting body. In fact, there is no parasympathetic innervation to sweat glands.

part.hint: Does the action support fight or flight or rest and digest?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Sympathetic nervous system activation would lead to reduced secretion of digestive enzymes and decreased activity in smooth muscles of the digestive system, which, in turn, would not support ingestion and digestion of a hearty meal.
Correct. Parasympathetic nervous system function optimally supports a rest and digest state.
